meanings.definition: To lure or entice (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies was toling me into the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The shiny object on the ground was toling the curious cat closer.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was toling the dog with its acorn collection.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious music toled the listeners into a trance-like state.
meanings.sent5: The colorful advertisement toled customers into the store with promises of great deals.

meanings.definition: To tempt or attract (someone) with the promise of something desirable.
meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked bread was toling me to the bakery.
meanings.sent2: The shiny new toy toled the child into the store.
meanings.sent3: The tempting aroma of the barbecue was toling the neighbors to join the party.
meanings.sent4: The sparkling jewelry toled her eyes to linger on the display.
meanings.sent5: The exciting movie trailer toled audiences to buy tickets for the premiere.

meanings.definition: To cause (someone) to feel a strong desire or urge to do something.
meanings.sent1: The thrilling adventure book was toling me to read it in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful sunset toled them to stay a little longer at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The energetic music toled everyone to get up and dance.
meanings.sent4: The captivating story toled her to turn the page and continue reading.
meanings.sent5: The mouth-watering aroma of the food toled them to order more dishes.
